items.title: Journalist Corey Mitchell Joins Inside Climate News as a Senior Editor
items.description: Corey Mitchell, an award-winning journalist, has joined Inside Climate News as a senior editor overseeing bureaus in the Midwest and New York and correspondents covering climate science and renewable energy.  Mitchell was previously an editor at The Seattle Times, where he led a team of reporters covering education in Washington state, and The Conversation, which […]

items.title: To Florida’s Miccosukee Tribe, the Lands Around Alligator Alcatraz Are Sacred, Pythons and All
items.description: MIAMI—Less than four miles from Alligator Alcatraz, the Everglades detention site where the Trump administration aims to incarcerate and deport thousands of undocumented migrants, is the chickee hut where Betty Osceola has lived all her life. items.title: Environmental Groups, EPA Spar In Court Over Trump’s Cancellation of Resiliency Funding
items.description: WASHINGTON—Last month, the town of Dante in Southwest Virginia’s Appalachia region saw about 3.5 inches of rainfall over a couple of hours. items.title: Uranium Company Receives Wyoming’s First Fast-Tracked Mining Permits
items.description: Uranium Energy Corp.’s Sweetwater uranium project has become the first mining proposal in Wyoming to be fast-tracked under President Donald Trump’s March executive order to increase U.S. mineral production.  The company announced Aug. 5 that it planned to expand its uranium mining operations in Wyoming’s Red Desert as a result of the expedited permitting process. items.title: Nations Meet in Geneva in a Final Push to End Plastic Pollution
items.description: Delegates from 184 countries met in Geneva Tuesday to resume negotiations in the last scheduled opportunity to halt the escalating plastic pollution crisis through a legally binding global agreement. items.title: Alabama Power Gets Approval to Buy $622 Million Natural Gas Plant, Expecting More Data Centers
items.description: MONTGOMERY, Ala.—Alabama state regulators have cleared the way for Alabama Power to purchase an 895-megawatt gas-fired power plant, further tying Alabama’s largest electric utility to climate-polluting natural gas for decades to come.  The three-member Alabama Public Service Commission unanimously approved a request from the utility to purchase the Lindsay Hill Generating Station near Billingsley.  The […]
